is it possible to work for example from a live CD on say hda2 as root, not to alter the partition but just to do some work in that partition without loseing data
sure, I do that often. I haven't used the ubuntu livecd for that, but it's all the same
thanks
for example, I've done mount /dev/hdd4 -text3 /mnt and then altered files under /mnt
mount -t<devtype> /dev/hda2 /mnt
<devtype> should be, more precisely, <filesystemtype> such as vfat, reiserfs, ext3, etc
thanks
once you have mounted on live cd then all the commands are like so mnt/dev/hda2/usr/src ? for example or is it mnt/usr/src?

it depends on what the partition is, and where you mounted it. if you'll note, the example I gave: mount /dev/hdd4 -text3 /mnt says that the partition is on /mnt so for what you're looking for, it'd be /mnt/usr/src
i will use  mount -t ext3  /dev/hda2 /mnt to mount hda2
but how do you save all the data in that hda2 before you umount hda2? you cannot do shutdown -r now from a live cd?
umount /dev/hda2 , that will write all data to that partition
